required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetics of Morphine and Oxycodone in Frail Elderly Undergoing Cardiac Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Pharmacokinetics of Morphine and Oxycodone in Frail Elderly Undergoing Cardiac Surgery - AGE AWARE II

collaborator.agency: Academisch Medisch Centrum - Universiteit van Amsterdam (AMC-UvA)

brief_summary.textblock:
- Single centre observational cohort study.
- 20 older patients undergoing cardiac surgery who receive standard of care pain treatment.
- Postoperative ICU: blood sampling to determine morphine and metabolite (M3G, M6G, noroxycodone and oxymorphone) pharmacokinetics
- After ICU discharge on general ward: blood sampling to determine morphine, oxycodone and metabolite (M3G, M6G, noroxycodone and oxymorphone) pharmacokinetics
- During study monitoring of pain scores, total opioid consumption, side effects (e.g. nausea, vomiting, pruritus), sedation and delirium scores.

detailed_description.textblock:
Postoperative pain after cardiac surgery in elderly patients is common and leads to postoperative complications. Opioids play an important role in treatment of postoperative pain after cardiac surgery. In frail elderly after cardiac surgery however dosing schemes for opioids are still unknown, potentially leading to inadequate treatment of pain and/or safety issues.
- Single center observational cohort study
- The study population includes frail patients ≥70 years undergoing elective cardiac surgery.
- Primary endpoints of this study is the concentration of morphine, oxycodone and metabolites in blood over time on behalf of pharmacokinetic modelling.
- Secondary endpoints of this study are the pharmacodynamic parameters of morphine, oxycodone and metabolites (M3G, M6G, noroxycodone and oxymorphone) in blood in frail patients; such as pain scores, postoperative opioid consumption, vital signs, side effects of opioids and the influence of covariates such as frailty, serum creatinine, Glomerular Filtration Rate (GFR) on the pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics of morphine and oxycodone.

primary_outcome.measure: M3G concentration in blood over time
primary_outcome.time_frame: Until three consecutive days after ICU discharge
primary_outcome.description: Analysis of serum concentrations of M3G, metabolite of morphine, for pharmacokinetic modelling

primary_outcome.measure: M6G concentration in blood over time
primary_outcome.time_frame: Until three consecutive days after ICU discharge
primary_outcome.description: Analysis of serum concentrations of M6G, metabolite of morphine, for pharmacokinetic modelling

primary_outcome.measure: Noroxycodone concentration in blood over time
primary_outcome.time_frame: Until three consecutive days after ICU discharge
primary_outcome.description: Analysis of serum concentrations of Noroxycodone, metabolite of oxycodone, for pharmacokinetic modelling

primary_outcome.measure: Oxymorphone concentration in blood over time
primary_outcome.time_frame: Until three consecutive days after ICU discharge
primary_outcome.description: Analysis of serum concentrations of Oxymorphone, metabolite of oxycodone, for pharmacokinetic modelling

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until three consecutive days after ICU discharge
secondary_outcome.description: NRS as pain measurement scale, reported by nurse in standard care, for pharmacodynamic modelling

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until three consecutive days after ICU discharge
secondary_outcome.description: Postoperative opioid consumption, mg per 24 hour, for pharmacodynamic modelling

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until three consecutive days after ICU discharge
secondary_outcome.description: Side effects of opioids (pruritis, vomiting, constipation, nausea), dichotomous (yes/no) each day by nurse/researcher, for pharmacodynamic modelling

secondary_outcome.measure: Vital sign observation: bloodpressure (in mmHg) by nurse
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until three consecutive days after ICU discharge
secondary_outcome.description: Systolic and diastolic bloodpressure (SBP, DBP), reported by nurse in standard care for pharmacodynamic modelling

secondary_outcome.measure: Vital sign observation: heartrate (in beats/minute) by nurse
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until three consecutive days after ICU discharge
secondary_outcome.description: Heartrate (HR) reported by nurse in standard care for pharmacodynamic modelling

secondary_outcome.measure: Vital sign observation: saturation (in %) by nurse
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until three consecutive days after ICU discharge
secondary_outcome.description: Saturation (SpO2), reported by nurse in standard care for pharmacodynamic modelling

intervention.description: Morphine and Oxycodone are used in daily practice as part of standard care. Morphine and Oxycodone will be acquired through the clinical pharmacy of St Antonius and administered according to the standard postoperative pain protocol.
intervention.other_name: Morphine HCl CF 10mg/mL solution for injection / infusion

study_pop.textblock: The study population includes 20 patients ≥70 years undergoing elective cardiac surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ≥70 years undergoing elective cardiac surgery.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing transcatheter aortic valve replacement or mitral valve repair
- Contra-indication for morphine and/or oxycodone

condition_browse.mesh_term: Drug-Related Side Effects and Adverse Reactions
